org.jcvi.jillion.core.datastore

Interface DataStoreUtil.AdapterCallback<F,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    F - the "From" type. This is the type that the original datastore has its type as
    T - the "To" type. This is the type that we want to convert the type F into which may require method calls or new object creation.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Function<F,T>
    Enclosing class:
    DataStoreUtil

    public static interface DataStoreUtil.AdapterCallback<F,T>
extends Function<F,T>
    AdapterCallback is a callback method that can convert one type into another. The DataStoreUtil.adapt(Class, DataStore, Function) factory method will call get(Object) to adapt the records in the original DataStore on all calls to DataStore.get(String) and the StreamingIterator.next() calls to the iterator returned by DataStore.iterator().
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default T apply(F from) 
      T get(F from)
      Get the adapted type from the original type.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Function

        andThen, compose, identity

    • Method Detail

      • get

        T get(F from)
        Get the adapted type from the original type.
        Parameters:
        from - the object to adapt; will never be null.
        Returns:
        an instance of the adapted type, can not be null. If this implementation returns null, then the adapted DataStore will throw a NullPointerException.

      • apply

        default T apply(F from)
        Specified by:
        apply in interface Function<F,T>
